head.title: New Editor at Digest Draws Attention

hedline.hl1: New Editor at Digest Draws Attention

abstract.p: Reader's Digest spokeswoman Donna Pierpont says new deputy editor Catherine Romano, former executive editor at Maxim, Details and Cosmopolitan who wrote and edited articles about sex and relationships, will have no role in determining magazine's editorial direction (S)

block.p: Reader's Digest is not known for its racy articles, but it did become the subject of an edgy item in the tabloid gossip pages last week. The magazine, based in Chappaqua, recently hired Catherine Romano as its deputy editor. Ms. Romano, as executive editor at Maxim, Details and Cosmopolitan, wrote and edited articles about sex and relationships.

Last week, Page Six, a gossip column in the The New York Post, speculated that Reader's Digest ''may have some steamy surprises in store'' as a result of hiring Ms. Romano. But the magazine says it is not about to roll out a Beer n' Babes issue anytime soon.

Last week, Page Six, a gossip column in the The New York Post, speculated that Reader's Digest ''may have some steamy surprises in store'' as a result of hiring Ms. Romano. But the magazine says it is not about to roll out a Beer n' Babes issue anytime soon.
Donna Pierpont, a Reader's Digest spokeswoman, said Ms. Romano's background ''has no bearing'' on the direction of the magazine and would cause ''no change at all'' in its editorial direction.
''We don't often find ourself in controversy,'' she added, ''but it does happen once in a while, and I'm not so sure that's bad.''
